elements.description:
`api-body-editor`
Renders different types of body editors. It works with AMF data model
but can be used separately.

## AMF support

The element supports [AMF](https://github.com/mulesoft/amf/)
`json-ld` model. The model can be generated from OAS or RAML spec by
default and other specs with appropriate plugin.

The element accepts `http://www.w3.org/ns/hydra/core#Operation`,
`http://raml.org/vocabularies/http#Request` or array of
`http://raml.org/vocabularies/http#Payload` definitions in AMF
vocabulary.

When AMF model is accepted it alters the UI to render only allowed
by the spec content types and therefore editors.

properties.name: eventsTarget
properties.description:
Events handlers target. By default the element listens on
`window` object. If set, all events listeners will be attached to this
object instead of `window`.

properties.name: _oldEventsTarget
properties.description: An event target used to attach listeners.

properties.name: amfModel
properties.description:
Generated AMF json/ld model form the API spec.
The element assumes the object of the first array item to be a
type of `"http://raml.org/vocabularies/document#Document`
on AMF vocabulary.

It is only usefult for the element to resolve references.

properties.name: ns
properties.description: A namespace for AMF model

properties.name: selected
properties.description:
Currently selected editor.

- 0 for Raw editor
- 1 for Form data
- 2 for Multipart
- 3 for File

properties.name: value
properties.description:
A HTTP body.

Depending of current editor selection the type can vary.

properties.name: contentType
properties.description:
When set it will attempt to run associated code mirror mode
(raw editor).
This element listens for the `content-type-changed` event and when
handled it will automatically update content type and `mode`.

properties.name: aware
properties.description: `raml-aware` scope property to use.

properties.name: amfBody
properties.description:
AMF json/ld model for body.
When set it resets editor settings and transform it to work with
data types defined in AMF only.

properties.name: _effectiveModel
properties.description: Computed final model for payload.

properties.name: hasAmfBody
properties.description:
Computed value, `true` when `amfBody` is set.
This controls how the view is rendered. AMF model has limited
number of media types supported by the API. When not existing
the edtior renders all possible types.

properties.name: noTextInput
properties.description: Computed value, if set then raw text input is hidden

properties.name: noFormData
properties.description: Computed value, if set then form data input is hidden

properties.name: noMultipart
properties.description: Computed value, if set then multipart input is hidden

properties.name: noFile
properties.description: Computed value, if set then file input is hidden

properties.name: editorSelectorHidden
properties.description: Computed value, true if the editor type selector is hidden.

properties.name: allowHideOptional
properties.description:
If set it computes `hasOptional` property and shows checkbox in the
form to show / hide optional properties.

properties.name: allowDisableParams
properties.description:
If set, enable / disable param checkbox is rendered next to each
form item.

properties.name: allowCustom
properties.description:
When set, renders "add custom" item button.
If the element is to be used withouth AMF model this should always
be enabled. Otherwise users won't be able to add a parameter.

properties.name: narrow
properties.description: Renders items in "narrow" view

properties.name: mimeTypes
properties.description:
List of supported mime types by this endpoint.
This information is read from AMF data model.

properties.name: selectedMimeType
properties.description:
RAML's type definition.
A JSON editor uses it to create a schema definition (as a JSON object of {name: type}) to
display autosuggestions.

properties.name: singleMimeType
properties.description:
Computed value.
It's `true` when the endpint supports single mime type.
In this case it won't render type selector.

methods.name: _eventsTargetChanged
methods.description:
Removes old handlers (if any) and attaches listeners on new event
event target.

params.name: eventsTarget
params.description:
Event target to set handlers on. If not set it
will set handlers on the `window` object.

methods.name: _ensureAmfModel
methods.description: Ensures that the model is AMF object.

methods.name: _getValue
methods.description: Gets a signle scalar value from a model.

params.name: model
params.description: Amf model to extract the value from.

params.name: key
params.description: Model key to search for the value

methods.name: _getValueArray
methods.description: Gets values from a model as an array of `@value` properties.

params.name: model
params.description: Amf model to extract the value from.

params.name: key
params.description: Model key to search for the value

methods.name: _hasType
methods.description: Checks if a model has a type.

return.desc: True if model has a type.

methods.name: _hasProperty
methods.description: Checks if a shape has a property.

methods.name: _computePropertyArray
methods.description: Computes array value of a property in a model (shape).

methods.name: _computePropertyObject
methods.description:
Computes a value of a property in a model (shape).
It takes first value of a property, if exists.

methods.name: _computeHasStringValue
methods.description: Tests if a passed argumet exists.

methods.name: _computeHasArrayValue
methods.description:
Computes if passed argument is an array and has a value.
It does not check for type or value of the array items.

methods.name: _computeDescription
methods.description: Computes description for a shape.

methods.name: _computeServerVariables
methods.description: Computes value for `serverVariables` property.

methods.name: _computeEndpointVariables
methods.description: Computes value for `endpointVariables` property.

methods.name: _computePayload
methods.description: Computes value for the `payload` property

methods.name: _computeReturns
methods.description: Computes value for `returns` property

methods.name: _computeSecurity
methods.description: Computes value for `security` property

methods.name: _computeHasCustomProperties
methods.description: Computes value for `hasCustomProperties` property.

methods.name: _computeEncodes
methods.description: Computes model's `encodes` property.

methods.name: _computeDeclares
methods.description: Computes list of declarations in the AMF api model.

params.name: model
params.description: AMF json/ld model for an API

methods.name: _computeReferences
methods.description: Computes list of references in the AMF api model.

params.name: model
params.description: AMF json/ld model for an API

methods.name: _computeWebApi
methods.description: Computes AMF's `http://schema.org/WebAPI` model

params.name: model
params.description: AMF json/ld model for an API

methods.name: _computeServer
methods.description: Computes value for `server` property that is later used with other computations.

methods.name: _computeEndpointUri
methods.description: Computes endpoint's URI based on `amfModel` and `endpoint` models.

methods.name: _getBaseUri
methods.description:
Computes base URI value from either `baseUri`, `iron-meta` with
`ApiBaseUri` key or `amfModel` value (in this order).

return.desc: Base uri value. Can be empty string.

methods.name: _getAmfBaseUri
methods.description: Computes base URI from AMF model.

params.name: protocols
params.description:
Listy of supporte dprotocols. If not
provided and required to compute the url it uses `amfModel` to compute
protocols

methods.name: _ensureUrlScheme
methods.description:
A function that makes sure that the URL has a scheme definition.
If no supported protocols information is available it assumes `http`.

params.name: protocols
params.description:
List of supported by the API protocols
An array of string like: `['HTTP', 'HTTPS']`. It lowercase the value.
If not set it tries to read supported protocols value from `amfModel`
property.

methods.name: _computeProtocols
methods.description: Computes supported protocols by the API.

methods.name: _computeExpects
methods.description: Computes value for the `expects` property.

methods.name: _computePropertyValue
methods.description:
Tries to find an example value (whether it's default value or from an
example) to put it into snippet's values.

methods.name: _computeEndpointModel
methods.description: Computes model for an endpoint documentation.

methods.name: _computeMethodModel
methods.description: Computes method for the method documentation.

methods.name: _computeType
methods.description: Computes a type documentation model.

methods.name: _computeSecurityModel
methods.description: Computes model for selected security definition.

methods.name: _computeDocument
methods.description: Computes a documentation model.

methods.name: _resolve
methods.description: Resolves a reference to an external fragment.

methods.name: _getExampleValue
methods.description: Gets string value for an example data model.

params.name: isJson
params.description:
If set it checks if the `raw` value is valid JSON.
If it isn't then it parses structured value.

methods.name: _computeExampleFromStructuredValue
methods.description: Computes an example from example structured value.

return.desc: Javascript object or array with structured value.

methods.name: _computeStructuredExampleValue
methods.description: Computes value with propert data type for a structured example.

methods.name: _computeHasAmf
methods.description: Computes value for `hasAmfBody`.

methods.name: _ctHandler
methods.description: Handler for content type changed event.

methods.name: _contentTypeChanged
methods.description:
Handler for content type change.
Updates state of the UI depending on AMF model.

methods.name: _updateAmfSelectedMime
methods.description: Updates selected model for AMF.

methods.name: _updateEditorsState
methods.description: Updates editors availability state depending on content type.

methods.name: _selectedChanged
methods.description: Replaces active body editor with new one.

methods.name: _notifyBodyChanged
methods.description: Notifies application about body change.

methods.name: __removeExistingPanel
methods.description: Removes any existing body panel from local DOM.

methods.name: __addCommonProperties
methods.description: Adds shared properties for all panels.

methods.name: _createRawPanel
methods.description: Creates instance of Raw body panel and adds it to local DOM.

methods.name: _createFormDataPanel
methods.description: Creates instance of Raw body panel and adds it to local DOM.

methods.name: _createFilePanel
methods.description: Creates instance of Raw body panel and adds it to local DOM.

methods.name: _createMultipartPanel
methods.description: Creates instance of Raw body panel and adds it to local DOM.

methods.name: _panelValueChanged
methods.description:
Handler for the `value-changed` event dispatched by an editor panel.
Updates this element value reported back to the application and
dispatches `body-value-changed` custom event so elements without
direct access to this element can act upon new information.

methods.name: _attachValues
methods.description:
Attaches value and value change listeners to current editor
after it's created.

methods.name: _propagateModel
methods.description:
Attaches data model to an editor when content type changes.

Currently only `form-data-editor` and `multipart-payload-editor`
support amf data model.

methods.name: _analyticsEvent
methods.description: Dispatches analytics event.

methods.name: _payloadKeyDown
methods.description:
Dispatches `send-request` custom event when the user pressed
`meta+enter` on Mac or `ctrl+enter` otherwise keys combination.

methods.name: _computeEditorSelectorHidden
methods.description:
Computes a value of the hidden attribute of the editory type selector.
Some content types are supported by only one type of the editor so in
this cases the editor should be hidden.

methods.name: _propertyChangeHandler
methods.description: Updates property value on current panel.

methods.name: _valueChanged
methods.description:
Updates value of the panel if `value` change and it is not
internal change.

methods.name: _allowHideOptionalChanged
methods.description: Updates `allowHideOptional` on a panel.

methods.name: _allowDisableParamsChanged
methods.description: Updates `allowDisableParams` on a panel.

methods.name: _allowCustomChanged
methods.description: Updates `allowCustom` on a panel.

methods.name: _narrowChanged
methods.description: Updates `narrow` on a panel.

methods.name: _copyToClipboard
methods.description: Coppies current body text value to clipboard.

methods.name: _amfChanged
methods.description:
A handler for `amfBody` property change.
Resets `mediaTypes` property as defined in the model.

methods.name: _ensurePayloadModel
methods.description:
Ensures that the passed model is an array of
`http://raml.org/vocabularies/http#Payload`
in the AMF vocabulary.
The element accepts `http://www.w3.org/ns/hydra/core#Operation`,
`http://raml.org/vocabularies/http#Request` or array of
`http://raml.org/vocabularies/http#Payload` definitions.
It selectes the array from the model.

return.desc:
Payload model of undefined if the model
is invalid for this element.

methods.name: _updateAmfMediaTypes
methods.description:
Creates a list of media types supported by the endpoint as defined in
API spec file.

methods.name: _buildExampleValue
methods.description: Builds an example value form a properties model.

methods.name: _notifyContentTypeChange
methods.description:
Dospatches `content-type-changed` custom event when CT changes by
using type selection.

methods.name: _typeSelectedChanged
methods.description: Notifies about content type change when type selection changes.

elements.name: ApiBodyEditor

attributes.name: events-target
attributes.description:
Events handlers target. By default the element listens on

object instead of `window`.

The element assumes the object of the first array item to be a
type of `"http://raml.org/vocabularies/document#Document`

It is only usefult for the element to resolve references.

attributes.name: selected

This element listens for the `content-type-changed` event and when

attributes.name: aware

AMF json/ld model for body.

number of media types supported by the API. When not existing

attributes.name: no-text-input
attributes.description: Computed value, if set then raw text input is hidden

attributes.name: no-form-data
attributes.description: Computed value, if set then form data input is hidden

attributes.name: no-multipart
attributes.description: Computed value, if set then multipart input is hidden

attributes.name: no-file
attributes.description: Computed value, if set then file input is hidden

attributes.name: editor-selector-hidden
attributes.description: Computed value, true if the editor type selector is hidden.

attributes.name: allow-hide-optional
attributes.description:
If set it computes `hasOptional` property and shows checkbox in the
form to show / hide optional properties.

attributes.name: allow-disable-params

If set, enable / disable param checkbox is rendered next to each

When set, renders "add custom" item button.

attributes.description:
RAML's type definition.

display autosuggestions.

attributes.name: single-mime-type
attributes.description:
Computed value.
It's `true` when the endpint supports single mime type.
In this case it won't render type selector.

events.name: content-type-changed
events.description: Dispatched when the user select media type from the list of available types.

events.name: send-request
events.description: Dispatched when the request should be invoked.
